intro: Lithospermum ambiguum, commonly known as the ambiguous lithosperm, is a perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and blue to purple flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough texture. Lithospermum ambiguum is often found in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun.
